description: This procurement has been set aside under the federal government's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB). In order to be considered, a supplier must certify that it qualifies as an Indigenous business as defined under PSIB and that it will comply with all requirements of PSIB.",
full_summary:
================================

### Work Hours and Support Requirements

The [Global Affairs Canada Agency](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/) requires client-focused resources to provide 24/7 support for IM/IT incidents, issues, and requests in various communication channels, including telephone, email, and chat.

**Contract Overview**
------------------------

The Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) has set aside this tender for Indigenous businesses. To be considered, suppliers must certify their Indigenous business status as per PSIB requirements.

**Key Responsibilities**
-------------------------

Support clients across the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) network, including employees, contractors, partners, and co-servants working from home or at DFATD locations in Canada and globally. Tasks include:

* Troubleshooting and resolving complex IM/IT issues
* Escalating incidents as necessary
* Operating the 24/7/365 help desk
* Working on a rotating shift schedule (8-hour shifts, with a 30-minute unpaid break)

**Contract Award**
------------------

Up to three (3) contracts are available for a total of 10 resources. The award will be made as part of a [voluntary set-aside](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/business/opportunities/instructionOOD/notice-of-wsm-guidelines) under PSIB.

**Attention**
------------

To respond to this request, suppliers must demonstrate their Indigenous business status. Failure to provide this confirmation may result in the supplier being deemed non-compliant with PSIB regulations.

For more information and to download the tender, please visit: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/4951/23-238384---npp_english.pdf|
